item.title: Lenovo issues global recall for Thinkpad batteries
item.description: Lenovo has expanded a battery recall that was first announced on March 27, 2014. This recall now includes all affected lithium-ion batteries globally. The batteries, as announced in late April 2015, were manufactured for ThinkPad notebook computers shipped between February 2010 and June 2012. Lenovo stated that they are offering free-of-charge replacement batteries for all recalled batteries in the interest of public safety. item.title: Understand your social media presence with Socialbakers' Social Health Index
item.description: Socialbakers, a company specializing in social media analytics and optimization, has launched its Social Health Index, a tool created in collaboration with Lenovo. This industry benchmark offers brands a single metric to assess their social marketing performance across multiple platforms. It allows them to effortlessly measure their overall social media presence and compare it to their competitors over a period of time. Jan Rezab, CEO and Co-Founder of Socialbakers, stated that the Social Health Index is the first benchmark of its kind, providing context to brands’ social marketing efforts.

item.title: Lenovo introduces the ThinkStation P series of desktop workstations
item.description: Lenovo has introduced the ThinkStation P Series, a new line of desktop workstations. The P900, P700, and P500 models join the entry-level P300, which was launched in May 2014, to form Lenovo’s most potent professional-grade desktop workstations. Rob Herman, Director of Worldwide Workstation Product and Vertical Marketing at Lenovo, stated that the company listened to customer feedback regarding the need for faster, more dependable, and user-friendly workstations, and the ThinkStation P Series is their response.
